name: Barclay ( South Fork )
description:
Introduction

A scenic and clean canyon with a variety of downclimbs and a few short rappels. Ending in a prestine pothole filled slickrock watercourse. Followed by a long exit up a locusts bush and choss filled gully.

Worth exploring and much better quality than the North fork.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Take a left in Bear sign. Hike to exit gully on left. Stay in the center of the exit drainage bypassing one steep crux or dry fall on the right and cross back over into main drainage until the top.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

Lars romig, Laura Stewart, Eric & Kegn Moorcroft Fall 2021.
